senses.de: The name given to a product or service from a specific company, used for marketing.
senses.ex: Apple Inc. is a global brand known for high-quality electronics.

Tips.title: Corporate Identity
Tips.description: A brand often embodies the reputation and values of a company.
Tips.example: The Disney brand represents family-friendly entertainment.

Tips.title: Global Recognition
Tips.description: Famous brands can be recognized all over the world, increasing their value.
Tips.example: Coca-Cola is one of the most recognized brands globally.

Tips.title: Brand Loyalty
Tips.description: People often have a strong preference for certain brands over others.
Tips.example: Many people have brand loyalty to Apple products.

senses.de: A specific type or kind of something
senses.ex: I prefer this brand of coffee over others.

Tips.title: Personal Choice
Tips.description: Some brands are preferred for personal reasons like taste or compatibility.
Tips.example: She bought that brand of shoes for their comfort.

Tips.title: Quality Perception
Tips.description: Brands can be seen as indicators of quality or status.
Tips.example: He chose that brand because it's associated with quality.

senses.de: A piece of burning or glowing wood or a mark made using burning tool
senses.ex: Back in the days, ranchers used to brand cattle to signify ownership

Tips.title: Historical Significance
Tips.description: Branding with a hot iron has historical roots in livestock ownership.
Tips.example: Farmers branded livestock to identify their animals.

Tips.title: Ownership Claim
Tips.description: Branding can symbolize ownership, not just for animals, but items too.
Tips.example: The custom guitar was branded with the musician's initials.

senses.de: To mark something or someone as if with a brand, particularly to show ownership or quality
senses.ex: The company branded its logo on all its products.

Tips.title: Visible Marking
Tips.description: Companies brand products to make their logos visible and recognizable.
Tips.example: Her phone was branded with the manufacturer's logo on the back.

Tips.title: Imprinting Quality
Tips.description: Branding can imply a certain level of quality and trust in a product.
Tips.example: They branded their appliances to assure customers of quality.

senses.de: To label or categorize someone or something, often negatively
senses.ex: He was branded a traitor after his actions were revealed.

Tips.title: Negative Labeling
Tips.description: Using 'brand' as a verb can have negative connotations when labeling people.
Tips.example: The politician was branded corrupt by the media.

Tips.title: Stigma Attachment
Tips.description: Branding someone can create a lasting stigma and affect their reputation.
Tips.example: Unfortunately, once branded a cheat, it's hard to lose the label.

Badge.wordDefinition:
A badge refers to a symbol or emblem that represents a particular organization or achievement. For example, a police officer's badge represents their authority and position in law enforcement.

Overall, badges are applicable in organizational contexts, while brands are applicable in marketing and business contexts.

Crest.wordDefinition:
Crest usually refers to a specific part of a brand, namely the logo or emblem that is usually displayed at the top of a company's letterhead, uniforms, or packaging.

In summary, while brand is a broad term that encompasses a company's overall identity, crest refers specifically to the logo or emblem that represents that identity.

Emblem.wordDefinition:
An emblem typically refers to a symbol or design that represents an organization or group. For example, the American flag can be considered an emblem of the United States.

A brand is used to create a unique identity for a particular company or product, whereas an emblem is used as a symbol to represent an organization or group.

Label.wordDefinition:
A label is a small piece of paper, fabric, or metal that is attached to a product to provide information about it. It might have the product name, ingredients, or instructions on how to use it.

For example, a jar of peanut butter might have a label that shows the nutritional information and the brand name.

Both brand and label are important in marketing a product. Brands help companies create a unique identity and attract customers, while labels provide important information that consumers need to make informed decisions about what they purchase.

Logo.wordDefinition:
A logo is a visual symbol that represents the brand.

Think of it like this: If a brand is a person, then a logo is the person's face. Just like a face can help you recognize someone, a logo can help you recognize a brand.

However, a person's face is just one small part of who they are - just like a logo is just one small part of a brand.

Both brand and logo are important for a company to have a successful and recognizable identity. But while a logo is used on things like signs, business cards, and ads, a brand is applicable to every aspect of a company's operations, including product design, customer service, and employee training.

Mark.wordDefinition:
A mark is usually just the logo or a symbol that represents the brand. It's like a visual shorthand that people can recognize as belonging to a particular company or product.

A brand is applicable when you want to talk about the overall image and reputation of a company or a product, while a mark is useful when you want to refer to its visual representation.

Symbol.wordDefinition:
A brand is a set of ideas and values that a company wants to be associated with, while a symbol is a visual representation of something, such as a logo or an icon.

For example, Nike's brand is all about athleticism, empowerment, and pushing oneself to be better. Their symbol is the iconic swoosh logo that represents their brand.

Brands are applicable in marketing and advertising to help create a specific image and reputation for a company, while symbols are often used within the branding to create recognizability and identity for the brand.

Trademark.wordDefinition:
A brand is a company's identity that is used to represent their products or services, while a trademark is a legal symbol that identifies and protects a brand's products or services from being copied by others.

For example, Nike is a brand that represents athletic products such as shoes and apparel. Nike's famous "swoosh" symbol is their trademark that ensures no other company can produce and sell products with the same symbol or brand name.

A brand is the overall image or identity of a company or product, while a trademark is a legal protection for a specific aspect of that brand identity.

quotes.Text: I think what I do in my acting world and what I do in my standup world is bring up a brand that I want to bring across. Once you figure out your brand and what you do, it's kind of easy at that. You end up getting your audience.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: J. B. Smoove

quotes.Text: I learned all my life skills working in a restaurant. How to have a relationship, manage, develop a brand, dress people, make people confident - everything.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Gok Wan

quotes.Text: I think the reason that we do things the way we do is because we respect the customer. And I don't look at what we do as anything less than any other brand.
quotes.Title: American Designer
quotes.Name: James Jebbia

quotes.Text: The most important thing a magazine can do online is maintain its brand and be very strong in terms of delivering on that brand.
quotes.Title: American Publisher
quotes.Name: Jann Wenner

quotes.Text: It's exciting to see a brand like Hershey's is getting into the gaming world.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Ninja

quotes.Text: I am crazy for good branding and really admire companies that get it right.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Emily Weiss

quotes.Text: Being branded number one restaurant in the world is actually very humbling.
quotes.Title: English Chef
quotes.Name: Heston Blumenthal

quotes.Text: As I said, I haven't spent a lot of time thinking about partner brands.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jim Cantalupo

quotes.Text: Brand names aren't important to me at all.
quotes.Title: American Rapper
quotes.Name: Wiz Khalifa

quotes.Text: Everything in our world is branded.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Debbie Millman
